pullRequest.body:
Given a category `C`, and a category `D` equipped with a shift by a monoid `A`, we define a structure `SingleFunctors C D A` which contains the data of functors `functor a : C â¥¤ D` for all `a : A` and isomorphisms `shiftIso n a a' h : functor a' â‹™ shiftFunctor D n â‰… functor a` whenever `n + a = a'`. These isomorphisms should satisfy certain compatibilities with respect to the shift on `D`.


---

When the derived category enters mathlib, this shall be used in order to redefine `Ext`-groups.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Thanks! (And also thanks Chris for reviewing this)
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9355729170/job/25751552002)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9355729170/job/25751552216)

```suggestion
  shiftIso (n a a' : A) (ha' : n + a = a') : functor a' â‹™ shiftFunctor D n â‰… functor a
  /-- `shiftIso 0` is the identity up to `shiftFunctorZero`. -/
  shiftIso_zero (a : A) :
    shiftIso 0 a a (zero_add a) = isoWhiskerLeft _ (shiftFunctorZero D A)
  /-- `shiftIso (m + n)` is the composition of `shiftIso n` with `shiftIso m` up
  to `shiftFunctorAdd`. -/
  shiftIso_add (n m a a' a'' : A) (ha' : n + a = a') (ha'' : m + a' = a'') :
    shiftIso (m + n) a a'' (by rw [add_assoc, ha', ha'']) =
      isoWhiskerLeft _ (shiftFunctorAdd D m n) â‰ªâ‰« (Functor.associator _ _ _).symm â‰ªâ‰«
        isoWhiskerRight (shiftIso m a' a'' ha'') _ â‰ªâ‰« shiftIso n a a' ha'
```
Maybe some description of the compatibility conditions?

```suggestion

/-- Construct an isomorphism in `SingleFunctors C D A` by giving
level-wise isomorphisms and checking compatibility only in the forward direction. -/
@[simps]
def isoMk (iso : âˆ€ a, (F.functor a â‰… G.functor a))
```

How is this used most often? Do you ever have a fixed `G` and consider the induced map  `SingleFunctors C D A â†’ SingleFunctors C E A` (the doc string seems to suggest this)? If yes, the order of the arguments should maybe be switched such that `G` comes first?
Thanks for the suggestions. I have changed the docstring.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Shift): functors from a category to a category with a shift

source.title: feat/refactor: redefinition of homology + derived categories
